newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's Ciampi outlines mini-budget measures.
newsitem.headline: Italy's Ciampi outlines mini-budget measures.

text.p: The Italian mini-budget will raise around six trillion lire this year by calling on companies to pay taxes ahead of time on severance payment funds, Treasury Minister Carlo Azeglio Ciampi said on Thursday.

A further six trillion lire will be raised next year by the same measure which will only affect firms with more than 15 employees, Ciampi told a news conference after the cabinet had approved the corrective package.
Ciampi said 2.6 trillion lire would be raised this year by delaying payment of severance handouts to state workers who took early retirement.
Some 1.3 trillion lire will be saved by cutting back ministerial budgets over the last nine months of the year, while four trillion lire will come from fiscal measures, Ciampi said.
The Treasury minister said that around 400 billion lire would come by extending an amnesty on non-payment of social security contributions.
Ciampi said that the state would reduce funds to the post service, adding that this would be compensated for by increasing postal charges. He gave no further details. -- Rome newsroom +396 6782501
